skill.name: Reporting
skill.description: Generate structured reports for troubleshooting sessions and sprint reviews using specialized report generator agents
skill.summary: Create detailed troubleshooting and sprint reports
skill.author: Emz1998

security_audit.summary: Static analysis flagged 'weak cryptographic algorithm' patterns in YAML description fields at issues/SKILL.md:3 and sprints/SKILL.md:3. Upon manual review, these findings are FALSE POSITIVES - the flagged content is simply the word 'report' in YAML frontmatter description fields. No cryptographic code, algorithms, or security-sensitive operations exist in this skill. The skill is a simple wrapper that invokes specialized report generator agents.

content.value_statement: Users struggle to document troubleshooting sessions and sprint progress in consistent formats. This skill invokes specialized agents to automatically generate structured, detailed reports that capture all relevant information.
actual_capabilities: Invokes @troubleshoot-report-generator agent to document troubleshooting sessions
Invokes @sprint-report-generator agent to create sprint summary reports
Captures problem details, steps taken, and resolutions
Formats reports with consistent structure and sections
Organizes sprint achievements, blockers, and next steps
limitations: Does not collect data from external sources automatically
Depends on user-provided session or sprint information
Report quality depends on input completeness

use_cases.title: Documenting Technical Troubleshooting
use_cases.description: After resolving a technical issue, generate a detailed troubleshooting report that captures the problem, root cause, solution steps, and lessons learned.
use_cases.target_user: Developers, IT support staff, system administrators

use_cases.title: Sprint Retrospectives and Reviews
use_cases.description: At the end of each sprint, generate a comprehensive sprint report summarizing completed work, impediments, team velocity, and planning notes.
use_cases.target_user: Product managers, Scrum masters, Agile team leads

use_cases.title: Knowledge Base Article Creation
use_cases.description: Transform troubleshooting session reports into knowledge base articles for future reference and team documentation.
use_cases.target_user: Technical writers, documentation engineers, team leads

prompt_templates.title: Basic Troubleshooting Report
prompt_templates.prompt:
Use the @troubleshoot-report-generator skill to create a troubleshooting report for this session:

Problem encountered: [Describe the issue]
Steps taken to diagnose: [List diagnostic steps]
Root cause found: [Explain what caused the problem]
Solution applied: [Describe how it was fixed]
Prevention measures: [Suggest how to avoid recurrence]

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Debugging Session
prompt_templates.prompt:
Generate a troubleshooting report for this debugging session using @troubleshoot-report-generator:

Environment: [Dev/Prod/Staging]
Error messages observed: [Paste error logs]
Investigation timeline: [When did it start, when was it noticed]
Debugging approach: [Methods used to find the issue]
Final resolution: [How the problem was resolved]
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a formal record of a production incident

prompt_templates.title: Sprint Summary Report
prompt_templates.prompt:
Use the @sprint-report-generator skill to create a sprint summary for [Sprint Name/Number]:

Sprint goal: [Original objective]
Features completed: [List delivered items]
Bugs fixed: [List resolved issues]
Work in progress: [Items not completed]
Blockers encountered: [What slowed the team]
Team velocity: [Story points or effort metrics]

prompt_templates.title: Sprint Retrospective Report
prompt_templates.prompt:
Generate a sprint retrospective report using @sprint-report-generator:

Sprint period: [Start and end dates]
What went well: [Successful practices to continue]
What could improve: [Areas for team improvement]
Action items for next sprint: [Specific improvement actions]
Team mood or health notes: [Optional team feedback]

output_examples.input:
Generate a troubleshooting report for this session:
Problem: Database connection timeout
Root cause: Connection pool exhausted
Solution: Increased pool size and implemented connection reuse
output_examples.output:
# Troubleshooting Report

**Issue:** Database Connection Timeout
**Date:** [Current Date]
**Status:** Resolved

## Problem Description
Database connection timeout errors observed in production environment.

## Root Cause
Connection pool was exhausted due to improper connection cleanup.

## Resolution
- Increased maximum pool size from 10 to 50
- Implemented proper connection cleanup in finally blocks
- Added connection health checks

## Prevention
- Monitor connection pool metrics
- Set up alerts for pool utilization above 80%

best_practices: Gather all relevant details before invoking the report generator to ensure complete documentation
Include specific error messages, timestamps, and environment details for troubleshooting reports
Use consistent naming conventions for sprint and issue identifiers
Review generated reports for accuracy before sharing with stakeholders
anti_patterns: Invoking the skill without providing sufficient context or details results in incomplete reports
Using the skill for real-time incident response may delay immediate response actions
Skipping the review step can lead to reports with missing critical information
Generating reports without a clear audience in mind reduces their usefulness

faq.question: What information do I need to provide for a troubleshooting report?
faq.answer: Include the problem description, steps taken to diagnose, root cause, solution applied, and any prevention measures. The more details you provide, the more comprehensive the report will be.

faq.question: Can I customize the report format?
faq.answer: The report generators produce structured formats. You can modify the output after generation or provide specific formatting instructions in your prompt.

faq.question: What sprint metrics should I include?
faq.answer: Useful metrics include story points completed, bugs fixed, work in progress, blockers encountered, and team velocity. Also consider including burndown data if available.

faq.question: How do I use this skill with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Simply include the skill trigger in your prompt. For troubleshooting, mention @troubleshoot-report-generator. For sprints, mention @sprint-report-generator.

faq.question: Can I generate reports for multiple sessions at once?
faq.answer: Yes, you can provide information for multiple issues or sprints in a single request, though keeping reports focused on single sessions improves clarity.

faq.question: Are the generated reports suitable for stakeholder presentations?
faq.answer: Yes, the reports are structured and professional. You may want to add executive summaries or adjust detail levels depending on your audience.
